title: Require a space between `function` and `(`.
body: The guide was inconsistent in its use of spacing, and the most common convention both inside Airbnb and in community JS is to require this space. This both adds a section on it, and enables the linting rule.

title: Explicitly clarify naming policy for React event handler methods
body: The [ordering section](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/tree/master/react#ordering) implies that event handlers should be named `onFoo` rather than `handleFoo` per FB examples. Is this an explicit rule? If so, it would be nice to have it listed in either the "naming" or "methods" sections.

title: why is space-in-parens disabled?
body:
Hello! This is a question not a bug :)

Looking at your examples you always use the following style: `if (x) {`, `functionCall(a, b, c)`. So, I was wondering why is [space-in-parens](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/space-in-parens) completely disabled in [your eslint config](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/style.js#L100)?

title: Enable Rest Params!
body:
For some reason this is disabled. This enables it.

Thanks!

title: Rule: Do not use || for defaulting
1.0.0 - Unexpected token = with static properties
airbnb eslint presets, which require all required presets inside them
body:
eslint add possibility for presets to have all required deps with them in [1.10](http://eslint.org/blog/2015/11/eslint-v1.10.0-released/). See eslint issues eslint/eslint#4407 and eslint/eslint#4263 so basically it should be possible to do short `npm install --save-dev eslint-config-airbnb eslint` instead of long and verbose `npm install --save-dev eslint-config-airbnb eslint-plugin-react eslint`. I think it’s easier and more cleaner approach.

I [tried this feature on small eslint presets](https://github.com/iamstarkov/eslint-test#readme) and it seems to be working. What do you think about implementing this way into airbnb presets?

title: linter won't let me use strict mode but still forces me to use 'let'
Lo/add vim setup syntastic
body: some extra help for vim users to get setup on Syntastic

title: Avoid the word "mutate" while explaining `const`
body: Since a common misconception about the `const` keyword in ES2015 is that it prohibits mutation of values when in fact it only prohibits mutation of references I think it’s clearer to avoid this word in this context completely. When we talk about mutability and immutability in JS we almost always mean _values_ and not _references_. So although the wording in this section is correct I think it should be re-phrased to avoid confusion. :)

title: * delete *
body: Wrong place sorry

title: Use require.resolve to allow nested extend
body:
By default eslint always resolves files in `extends` relative to the top-level project. Using `require.resolve` converts the references to absolute paths. Example:

```
node_modules/
  eslint-config-groupon/
    node_modules/
      eslint-config-airbnb/
        index.js # refers to 'eslint-config-airbnb/base'
```

By default eslint will look for `eslint-config-airbnb/base` in the top-level node_modules directory instead of one level down. By using `require.resolve` the "normal" npm resolution rules apply.

We use this approach in `eslint-config-groupon`. This change would allow us to get rid of [the uglier parts](https://github.com/groupon/javascript/blob/master/linters/eslint-config-groupon/legacy.js#L28-L48) in that repo.

title: add missing rules from eslint-plugin-react (enforcing where necessary )
body:
Adds all missing rules from `eslint-plugin-react`.

Enforces [`react/jsx-closing-bracket-location`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/blob/master/docs/rules/jsx-closing-bracket-location.md) and [`react/jsx-indent-props`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/blob/master/docs/rules/jsx-indent-props.md) to match react style guide.

title: Bring back note about braces
body: https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/pull/472#discussion_r44334308

title: [eslint] Enforce rule 18.5
body:
Rule [18.5](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#18.5) states that files shall end with a single newline
character. Until now, this was not checked because there was no such
option in eslint.

Since version 1.8.0, eslint provides the ability to do that. See [pull
request on eslint](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/4266) for details on implementation and usage. Let's use
it in airbnb eslint plugin now!

title: React eslint not catching the use of underscore with internal methods
body:
In the [React/JSX Styleguide 'Methods' section](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/react/README.md#methods) it says you shouldn't use `_` to prefix internal methods. However, some of my code contains this convention and it isn't being caught by the linter. I double-checked the eslint rules for react/jsx files and there doesn't seem to be a rule defined for this convention.

Is this intentional? If so, why specify the rule in your documentation? I found a related issue (#490), but it wasn't clearly stated whether or not this rule should definitely be adhered to but rather that it's more or less up to the programmer.

Any clarification would be greatly appreciated.

title: Add Evolution Gaming to 'In The Wild' section
body: We're excited in Evolution Gaming to see a movement to encourage good practices in ES6 programming.

title: Allow multiple stateless components in a single file
body:
IDK if you want it, but we had linting errors after upgrading eslint-plugin-react.

This change allows multiple stateless components in a single file.

Requires 3.80 of eslint-plugin-react
https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#380---2015-11-07
